Header: President expresses confidence in capabilities of Sri Lanka’s engineers
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena made a statement at the annual conference of the Institution held on Thursday April 2 in Colombo. President Sirisena emphasised the need to place faith in local engineers when undertaking development projects. The Institution of Engineers Sri Lanka which boasts of over 2500 creations in the agriculture, irrigation and engineering fields is Asia’s oldest engineering institution. MTV / MBC Networks were the media partners for the National Engineering Conference. President Maithripala Sirisena noted since he was in parliament for over 25 years and worked with medical professionals for the past five years he understands the difference between doctors and engineers. The President also stated that it is important that we have faith and strength in the knowledge that the Sri Lankan Engineers possess when it comes to the development of the country. He stated that they will therefore make it a government policy to strengthen the Sri Lankan engineers. He also stated that he will look into the matters of the Engineering Council personally and expedite the drafting of the National Engineering Council
